title: Aftershock resists should be reduced for ranged champions

replies.body: Aftershock should scale off of bonus resists and shouldn't give loads of flat resistances to whoever wants them.

My second item is Righteous Glory (30 Armor) finished around 20 minutes.
So the only bonus resistance I have after 20 minutes (2/3 of the game) is just 30 Armor.

honestly, just letting the thing scale off of total resistances would work.  Squishy (normally ranged) champs normally have less base and natural scaling resistances, while the intended champions usually have quite a bit.  Then the intended champions usually also build more resistances on top of that.  

This combination is key: since even squishy champions have access to some pretty high resistance items.  Banshee's Veil has 65 mr, while GA has 40 armor and with boots up to 60 bonus armor, the same some fighters or jugernaughts might build.  But the difference is that those champions have MUCH higher base resistances.

The issue with this plan is that it was already tried.  On RELEASE that was actually how the rune worked.   No one took it.  I think the meta has shifted in a way where a revert would be apropriate now, where the resistance scaling could be MUCH higher than they were, potentially up to 100% ratios.  

Check out this link for a patch history of Aftershock
https://leagueoflegends.fandom.com/wiki/Aftershock

Why does EVERYTHING have to be weaker on range champions? They already suffer in base stats, usually have very few defensive steroids.

Because certain things just wouldn't be balanced on ranged champions. Tiamat, for instance, would give ADCs much better waveclear, and it's cheaper than Runaan's and also can build into Titanic, allowing ADCs to stack health and just sit back. Speaking of health, imagine of a ranged champ could permaslow you by 40% with frozen mallet, that wouldn't be fun. Same thing for Glacial. Rageblade is much harder to get full stacks on, and is therefore given a crutch to help out melee users. Ranged champions could also take advantage of Knight's Vow to heal off of the damage their ADC or jungler deals without having to get close to the fight, or build full damage items, and Relic shield items would be abused by ADCs more to heal and their supports. Champions like Kog'Maw and pretty much every other ADC would abuse Conqueror by being able to constantly have bonus AD and true damage in an extended fight, and ranged champions would be able to stay much safer if they were able to land a free Grasp proc whenever they wanted for the full heal and bonus health amount.

Not saying this is the most effective method, but that is simply how they balance melee and ranged champions. The reason why ranged champions tend to out base-stats melee champions is that they have completely different itemization most of the time, if not always. All items that melee champions tend to build add a lot to their defensiveness with bits of offensiveness. Ranged champions get bits of defensiveness from their items, but the main stat attributes are offensive. It's difficult to simply look at base stat alone when itself was designed to go hand-in-hand with itemisation.
